title: Monalisa
history: The is a famous painting by Leonardo da Vinci, portraying a woman with an enigmatic smile. The artwork is renowned for its innovative technique and captivating expression, making it an icon of Renaissance art and one of the most famous paintings in the world.
detail: The artwork is composed of three main techniques: Sfumato, Chiaroscuro, and Enigmatic Expression.

title: The Scream
history: By Edvard Munch is an iconic work of expressionist art, depicting a silent scream of despair and anguish. The distorted figure and vibrant colors convey a sense of existential terror. The painting is a powerful representation of universal human emotions.
detail: Created in 1893. Munch used expressive brushstrokes and vibrant colors to convey the intense emotions in the work. The composition includes distorted forms and a striking use of curved and angular lines to highlight feelings of agony and despair. The contrasting colors, like the orange sky and blue river, add to the unsettling atmosphere. Munch's expressionist technique in 'The Scream' showcases his innovative and emotive portrayal of the human experience.

title: Davi
history: Michelangelo's sculpture of David is a Renaissance masterpiece depicting the biblical hero in white marble. Standing at 5.17 meters tall, it showcases impressive details like the focused facial expression and well-defined muscles, conveying strength and determination before the battle against Goliath.
detail: The artwork is composed of three main techniques: Expressive brushstrokes, Dramatic use of colors, and Distorted forms.

title: Flower Thrower
history: Is an iconic piece of street art depicting a protester throwing a bouquet of flowers instead of a weapon. This powerful image symbolizes hope, peace, and nonviolent resistance, challenging conventions and prompting reflections on social and political issues.
detail: Banksy primarily uses the stencil technique in his artworks. He creates his designs in layers using stencils to apply paint precisely and create detailed images in his works of art. In addition, he also uses spray paint and acrylic to complement his creations.

title: Rio de Janeiro
history: Rio de Janeiro is a stunning city in Brazil, renowned for its breathtaking beaches like Copacabana and Ipanema, and iconic landmarks such as the Christ the Redeemer statue and Sugarloaf Mountain. With a unique blend of culture, music, and impressive landscapes, Rio captivates visitors from around the world.
